You don't necessarily have to FC the songs you play you can do a pretty shitty job on score/combo and still get gold/silver drops depending on your luck. Usually if there is a friend or student popup before the song starts and if you get a friend popup it will give a higher chance of those gold and silver drops I believe along with other boosts. Or if you have the coins to spend just pay for 100k coin boost to get a increase chance for g/s drops (the first option when you go to pay for boosts)

yeah definitely! if you dont feel too confident in your score/combo you can try purchasing the boosts and see if that helps but personally i would just keep rolling with the 3x hard songs only w/ the chance to increase event points boost (2nd to last option) good luck you'll get maki in no time;;
i think the vocals are pre-recorded and then remastered with the original audio. anyways im down for this i can lend my 5 year old voice for the high notes.

The current honor student scouting is not SR guaranteed so definitely don't scout that one unless you want a bunch of R :/ The lily white scouting is nice if you like the subunit girls but there definitely a high chance you'll get more Rs rather than the wanted SR/UR. Save your loveca until next SR guaranteed or if you really can't wait go for lily white

You can probably try to get yukata umi again once smile scout comes back around or wait until next year for august-november ur/sr scout or second years only scout other than that your best would be right now. If your feeling lucky I say go for it.

Rin is my number 1 girl because despite having a lot of similarities (interest in sports, being really determined, both of us loooove ramen, etc.) we are also totally different from each other (she wants to be more girly, while i want to be more boyish) Rin is also a little ball of sunshine since she is always very positive and eccentric while in terms of personality i'm more Hanayo then anything... both very awkward and shy. Whenever I see Rin and how energetic she really makes me want to go out and try something fun and break out my awkzone kinda like how she pushes Hanayo out there to become something she loves which is an idol. I really admire Rin for being so hardworking and caring towards her friends, honestly she makes me want to be a better person for my own sake and for the people I care about. Ok sorry that got really personal and super long but yeah... Anyways you're art is super cute! (your one piece art lt;333) I think might purchase a charm later on since those are really nice especially the Saitama one;;
"finally got something other than a scouting ticket" i wish i can say that too :cc all i get are alpacas...

You have a pretty ideal Pandora team (minus haku but ronia is a good as well) Pandora / Loki / Hanzo / Ronia / Dvalk / Pandora You can either go either D/D Loki or D/B Loki depending if you want a future balance team or not (since you have couple of good balance subs) however he does lose his God subtyping. Also with the Dvalk Uevo out I would switch Persephone out for her. Dark enhance, 2 prong, and a skill boost will definitely come in handy later on. I also run have Pandora first slot fully awoken + egging her so feel free to add me! My id is in my flair.
I had to delete some games off my phone for SIF but it was worth it...not so sure about the toll it had on my social life tho.

I can see how it can be offensive considering it originated from a mocking manner of the term "wife" and how it's usually associated w/ otakus and weaboos... which is not a good thing at all really. But it's gonna be really tough for people to cut back on it let alone grasp the context behind it since it's such a commonly used word nowadays. While most of the time people do not mean harm by but it is still an "engrish" mocking term. Same goes for husbando. Tbh I was a repeat offender of using this term but after learning about it I tried to cut back on it as much as possible seeing how it is associated with such things. It'll usually pop back into my vocabulary now and then but not intentionally tho so I still gotta work on that. tl;dr: word is associated w/ weaboos not a thing to be proud of. use the word best girl/guy/god/monster/dragon/whatever in replacement
*Kaneki never stood a chance against the Coco mob* I bet most players were like "wth is a coco" or "oh look another free win!" since we all dodged so much...

The scene from Azumanga Daioh the teacher says "my wife" so joking about mispronounciation of an non-native english speaker is ok I guess? I never really touched onto the topic of how it can be offensive to some but believe it or not behind all that modern day technology there is an actual person! And that person may be offended by things you may not find offensive for whatever reason. Am I saying you should be offended by it or stop using the word just because I or the mod says so? No of course not but I am just saying people should take into consideration of updating their vocabulary for words that are less tacky.

WRITING.TITLE: 100 Love Live! Icons
WRITING.TEXT: Hi everyone! Since it's winter break I decided to use some of the free time I have to make some icons. These are all 285 x 285px so perfect for twitter or you can resize them to use on any other forum, blog, etc. The album includes 10 icons for each #956;'s member + 10 random normal cards. [Icons](http://imgur.com/a/d3XH1) + [bonus nico](http://i.imgur.com/dAXtALx.png) I will also be taking requests for things like wallpapers, headers, and icons for the time being so feel free to ask for those too! **Edit**: If you are requesting something like a wallpaper please be sure to give me your screen resolution or what phone you have so I can make the graphic the best fit for your desktop/device!
I'm assuming the idolized Nozomi vers? Do you mind telling your screen resolution? //just so i can make sure it fits on your desktop//

Your experience reminds me a bit of my own. My neighbors and I found a lost kitty a couple years back. Before listening to #956;'s I listened to Kpop and still do to this day. I think I started listeing to korean music in 2007-2008? Somewhere in that time period when Big Bang debuted. After that whole phase I stopped listening for a while then listened to whatever including some J-Rock/Vocaloid. I got back into kpop in 2011 when it started becoming more popular over here in the states and been on that train ever since. Talking to other kpop fans introduced to me to Jpop idols which I wasn't a fan of before but now I love japans giant idol groups. I was into AKB48 before Yuko graduated and into Momusu before Reina graduated as well. I was also obsessed with Weather Girls when they debuted with the super catchy [Doki Doki Typhoon](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jd2-Nf86jvA). Nowadays I'm not super into groups anymore but listen to soloists or bands + anime osts but I still love idols like #956;'s lt;3
SNSD are considered idols as well. They are just korean idols. IMO A-RISE is more a Orange Caramel than 2ne1.

I definitely recommend getting to the festival through the shuttle. They usually have a little dedicated area to strictly for festival goers and have several in rotation at a time. I went to Tropicalia last year and it looked like hell for everyone taking ubers/driving.

Yeah, it was mainly getting out. Your plan of getting out through the shuttle is probably your best bet. Another interesting way to get to the venue is also through the aqua bus. Long Beach just started doing this Free Ride bus that covers a majority of downtown. A driver suggested to me that you can catch a ride to an aqua bus and they possibly give discounts as well for the aqua bus (don #8217;t quote me on this lol)
If you are planning to live closer to downtown lb I recommend @aerialbutterflies on ig! They have classes inside Groundwork Fitness on Pine :)
